content:
DriveListBox Class

Definition

Enables a user to select a valid disk drive at run time.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.Designer(typeof(Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.CompatibilityComboBoxDesigner))]
[System.Obsolete("Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.* classes are obsolete and supported within 32 bit processes only. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=160862")]
public class DriveListBox : System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox

Remarks

Use this control to display a list of all the valid drives in a user's system. You can create dialog boxes that enable the user to open a file from a list of files on a disk in any available drive.

If you also display the DirListBox and FileListBox controls, you can write code to synchronize them with the DriveListBox control and with each other.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Constructors

DriveListBox()

Initializes a new instance of the DriveListBox class.

public DriveListBox ();

Remarks

A DriveListBox control enables a user to select a valid disk drive at run time.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Properties

DataSource

Gets or sets the data source for a ComboBox.

public object DataSource { get; set; }
Value
Object

An object that implements the IList or IListSource interfaces, such as a DataSet or a Array. The default is null.

Remarks

This property should not be set for the DriveListBox control; it is provided only because the DriveListBox control inherits from ComboBox.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

DisplayMember

Gets or sets the property to display for this ListControl.

public string DisplayMember { get; set; }
Value
String

A String that represents the name of an object property and is contained in the collection specified by the crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DriveListBox.DataSource* property. The default is an empty string ("").

Remarks

This property should not be set for the DriveListBox control; it is provided only because the DriveListBox control inherits from ComboBox.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

DrawMode

Gets or sets the drawing mode for a ComboBox.

public System.Windows.Forms.DrawMode DrawMode { get; }
Value
DrawMode

One of the stem.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.DrawMode* values that represent the mode for drawing the items of the control. The default is DrawMode.

Remarks

This property should not be set for the DriveListBox control; it is provided only because the DriveListBox control inherits from ComboBox.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Drive

Gets or sets the selected drive at run time.

public string Drive { get; set; }
Value
String

A String expression that specifies the selected drive.

Remarks

The valid drives for the Drive property include all drives present in or connected to the system when the control is created or refreshed at run time. The default setting of the Drive property is the current drive.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

DropDownStyle

Gets or sets a value that specifies the style of a DriveListBox combo box.

public System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxStyle DropDownStyle { get; set; }
Value
ComboBoxStyle

One of the ComboBoxStyle values. The default is ComboBoxStyle.

Remarks

The DropDownStyle property controls the interface that is presented to the user. You can enter a value that provides a simple drop-down list box, where the list always appears, a drop-down list box, where the text portion is not editable and you must select an arrow to view the drop-down, or the default drop-down list box, where the text portion is editable and the user must press the arrow key to view the list. To always display a list that the user cannot edit, use a ListBox control.

If you set the DropDownStyle property to ComboBoxStyle, you can select only valid values from the list. If you set the DropDownStyle property to ComboBoxStyle, you can type any value in the editable area of the DriveListBox.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

ItemHeight

Gets the height of an item in the ComboBox.

public int ItemHeight { get; }
Value
Int32

The height, in pixels, of an item in the control.

Remarks

This property is not required for the DriveListBox control; the DriveListBox does not support items of variable height. It is provided only because the DriveListBox control inherits from ListBox.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Items

Gets the items that are contained in a DriveListBox.

public System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.ObjectCollection Items { get; }
Value

A ListBox.ObjectCollection that represents the items in the DirListBox.

Remarks

Use this property to retrieve a list of drives that are currently displayed in a DriveListBox.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Items(Int32)

Gets the item for a specified index in a DriveListBox.

public string Items[int Index] { get; }
Index
Int32

The number of a specific item in the list.

Value
String

A String that contains the name of the drive at the specified Index.

Remarks

Use this property to retrieve the name of a drive in a DriveListBox.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

MaxLength

Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum length of text displayed in a DriveListBox.

public int MaxLength { get; set; }
Value
Int32

An Integer that specifies the maximum length for the crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DriveListBox.Drive* property.

Remarks

Use this property to limit the length of text that a user can enter into the DriveListBox.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Sorted

Gets a value indicating whether the items in a DriveListBox is sorted alphabetically.

public bool Sorted { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if items in the control are sorted; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

For the DriveListBox control, Sorted always returns false.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Text

Gets the text displayed in a DriveListBox.

public string Text { get; }
Value
String

A String that contains the text that is displayed.

Remarks

If the Text is a valid drive, the value of the Text property is the same e as the Drive property.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

ValueMember

Gets or sets the property to use as the actual value for the items in a DriveListBox.

public string ValueMember { get; set; }
Value
String

A String that represents the name of an object property and is contained in the collection specified by the crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DriveListBox.DataSource* property. The default is an empty string ("").

Remarks

This property should not be set for the DriveListBox control; it is provided only because the DriveListBox control inherits from ComboBox.

In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. Methods

Dispose(Boolean)

Releases the unmanaged resources that are used by a DriveListBox control and optionally releases the managed resources.

protected override void Dispose (bool disposing);
disposing
Boolean

true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

Remarks

This method is called by the public Dispose() method and the Finalize method. Dispose() invokes the protected Dispose(Boolean) method with the disposing parameter set to true. Finalize invokes Dispose with the disposing parameter set to false.

When the disposing parameter is true, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this control references. This method invokes the Dispose() method of each referenced object.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. Raises the BackColorChanged event.

protected override void OnBackColorChanged (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

A EventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Events.

The OnBackColorChanged method also enables derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

WndProc(Message)

Processes Windows messages.

protected override void WndProc (ref System.Windows.Forms.Message m);
m
Message

The Windows Message to process.

Remarks

All messages are sent to the WndProc method after being filtered through the PreProcessMessage method.

The WndProc method corresponds exactly to the Windows WindowProc function. For more information about processing Windows messages, see the WindowProc function documentation in the Windows Platform SDK reference located on the MSDN Library Web site.
